qas.question: What position did Hayek gain at the Austrian Institute?
Who requested that Hayek be employed by LSE?
What sort of recognition had Hayek received when he came to London?

answers.text: one of the leading economic theorists in the world

qas.question: What subject did Hayek's works influence and inspire?
In what year did Hayek come to London?

context: With the help of Mises, in the late 1920s Hayek founded and served as <a0_0>director<a0_0/> of the Austrian Institute for Business Cycle Research, before joining the faculty of the London School of Economics (LSE) in <a4_0>1931<a4_0/> at the behest of <a1_0>Lionel Robbins<a1_0/>. Upon his arrival in London, Hayek was quickly recognised as <a2_0>one of the leading economic theorists in the world<a2_0/>, and his development of the economics of processes in time and the co-ordination function of prices inspired the ground-breaking work of John Hicks, Abba Lerner, and many others in the development of <a3_0>modern microeconomics<a3_0/>.
